required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Exploratory Study to Evaluate Immune Determinants of the Response to Adoptive Cell Therapy (ACT) in Solid and Hematologic Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Trial to Evaluate Immune Determinants of the Response and the Toxicity to Adoptive Cell Therapy (ACT) in Solid and Hematologic Tumors

lead_sponsor.agency: Gustave Roussy, Cancer Campus, Grand Paris

clinical_study.source: Gustave Roussy, Cancer Campus, Grand Paris

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a study to explore the phenotypic and transcriptional changes of different cellular components in the tumor following the injection of somatic cell therapy drugs.
The second objective is to explore phenotypic and transcriptional changes of different cellular components in blood and bone marrow following injection of somatic cell therapy drugs.Then correlate the phenotypic and transcriptional profile of different tumor, blood and bone marrow immune populations with clinical response and/or toxicity. And to finish this study is designed in order to identify a phenotypic, transcriptional and epigenetic profile of intra-tumoral adoptive cells and correlate this profile with clinical response and/or toxicity.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of frequency, phenotype and transcriptional profile of the different immune subsets in the tumor following adoptive cell therapy infusion using spectral flow cytometry and RNA sequencing

secondary_outcome.description: Defined by RECIST 1.1 score for lymphoma and solid tumors
Defined as the time between the adoptive cell therapy and progression, or death whatever the cause, whichever occurs first.
Defined as the time between the adoptive cell therapy injection and death whatever the cause

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of biopsies procedures (when applicable) graded according to CTCAE v5.0
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to 30 days after the last sample

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients receiving advanced therapy medicinal products

intervention.description: 3 biopsies will be collected: at baseline, at day+15 and optionally at relapse
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients receiving advanced therapy medicinal products

intervention.description: 7 blood samples (25ml) will be taken: at day-7 before treatment start, at day0, at day+3, day+7, day+15, month+3 and at relapse
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients receiving advanced therapy medicinal products

intervention.description: If a bone marrow biopsy or aspiration is performed as part of routine care, 1 mL of bone marrow aspiration or one more biopsy will be sampled
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients receiving advanced therapy medicinal products

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient affiliated to a social security regimen
- Tumor lesion accessible to core biopsies
- Patient who is fully informed, able to comply with the protocol and who signed the informed consent
- Pediatric patients > than 2 years old can be included
- No restriction about the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) status
Exclusion Criteria:
- Coagulation abnormality prohibiting a biopsy, (but patients can still give their consent for blood and bone marrow samples).
- Tumor lesion not accessible to core biopsies.
- Pregnant or nursing women cannot participate in this study.

facility.name: Gustave Roussy Cancer Campus Grand Paris
